Status chi tiáº¿t systemctl is-active myapp # Check if running systemctl is-enabled myapp # Check if enabled systemctl is-failed myapp # Check if failed systemctl show myapp # Show all properties systemctl show -p MainPID myapp # Show specific property #=== MASK/UNMASK === systemctl mask myapp.service # Prevent starting (link to /dev/null) systemctl unmask myapp.service # Allow starting again9.2 Listing Units #=== LIST UNITS === systemctl list-units # All loaded units systemctl list-units --all # Include inactive systemctl list-units --type=service # Only services systemctl list-units --state=failed # Only failed systemctl list-units --state=running # Only running #=== LIST UNIT FILES === systemctl list-unit-files # All unit files systemctl list-unit-files --type=service # Only services systemctl list-unit-files --state=enabled # Only enabled #=== LIST DEPENDENCIES === systemctl list-dependencies myapp # What myapp needs systemctl list-dependencies --reverse myapp # What needs myapp systemctl list-dependencies --all myapp # Full tree #=== LIST TIMERS === systemctl list-timers # All timers systemctl list-timers --all # Include inactive #=== LIST SOCKETS === systemctl list-sockets # All sockets9.3 Unit File Management #=== RELOAD DAEMON === systemctl daemon-reload # Sau khi edit unit files systemctl daemon-reexec # Re-execute systemd #=== EDIT UNITS === systemctl edit myapp.service # Create override (drop-in) systemctl edit --full myapp # Edit full unit file systemctl revert myapp # Remove overrides # Override location: /etc/systemd/system/myapp.service.d/override.conf #=== CAT UNIT === systemctl cat myapp.service # Show unit file content #=== VERIFY === systemd-analyze verify myapp.service # Check syntax9.4 System Control #=== POWER MANAGEMENT === systemctl poweroff # Shutdown systemctl reboot # Reboot systemctl suspend # Suspend to RAM systemctl hibernate # Hibernate to disk systemctl hybrid-sleep # Hybrid (suspend + hibernate) #=== TARGETS === systemctl get-default # Current default target systemctl set-default multi-user.target systemctl isolate rescue.target # Switch to rescue #=== SYSTEM STATE === systemctl is-system-running # Check system state # States: initializing, starting, running, degraded, maintenance, stopping, offline #=== RESCUE/EMERGENCY === systemctl rescue # Enter rescue mode systemctl emergency # Enter emergency mode9.5 User Services # User services cháº¡y trong user session #=== USER COMMANDS === systemctl --user start myapp.service systemctl --user enable myapp.service systemctl --user status myapp.service systemctl --user daemon-reload # User unit locations: # ~/.config/systemd/user/ # /etc/systemd/user/ # /usr/lib/systemd/user/ # Enable lingering (services cháº¡y khÃ´ng cáº§n login) loginctl enable-linger username loginctl disable-linger username 10. JOURNALD - LOGGING 10.1 journalctl Basics #=== BASIC VIEWING === journalctl # All logs journalctl -f # Follow (tail -f) journalctl -n 100 # Last 100 entries journalctl -r # Reverse order (newest first) #=== BY UNIT === journalctl -u myapp.service # Logs cá»§a service journalctl -u myapp -u nginx # Multiple units journalctl -u "myapp*" # Wildcard #=== BY TIME === journalctl --since "2024-01-01" journalctl --since "1 hour ago" journalctl --since "09:00" --until "10:00" journalctl --since yesterday journalctl -b # Current boot journalctl -b -1 # Previous boot journalctl --list-boots # List all boots #=== BY PRIORITY === journalctl -p err # Error and above journalctl -p warning # Warning and above # Priorities: emerg(0), alert(1), crit(2), err(3), warning(4), notice(5), info(6), debug(7) #=== BY FIELD === journalctl _PID=1234 journalctl _UID=1000 journalctl _SYSTEMD_UNIT=myapp.service journalctl _COMM=nginx journalctl _EXE=/usr/bin/nginx journalctl _HOSTNAME=webserver #=== OUTPUT FORMAT === journalctl -o short # Kernel messages only journalctl -k -b # Kernel messages this boot10.2 Advanced Queries # Combine filters (AND logic) journalctl -u nginx -p err --since today # Field matching journalctl CONTAINER_NAME=myapp journalctl _TRANSPORT=kernel # RuntimeMaxFileSize=... RuntimeMaxFiles=... # Rate limiting RateLimitIntervalSec=30s RateLimitBurst=10000 # Forward to other systems ForwardToSyslog=no ForwardToKMsg=no ForwardToConsole=no ForwardToWall=yes MaxLevelStore=debug # Max level to store MaxLevelSyslog=debug # Max level to syslog MaxLevelKMsg=notice # Max level to kernel MaxLevelConsole=info # Max level to console MaxLevelWall=emerg # Max level to wall TTYPath=/dev/console MaxFileSec=1month # Rotate after this time MaxRetentionSec=1year # Delete after this time10.4 Structured Logging # Log tá»« script vá»›i systemd-cat echo "Hello from script" | systemd-cat -t myscript -p info # Vá»›i priority echo "Error occurred" | systemd-cat -t myscript -p err # Log structured fields (trong code) # Python: from systemd import journal # journal.send('Hello', FIELD1='value1', FIELD2='value2') # Xem structured fields journalctl -u myapp -o verbose 11. SYSTEMD-ANALYZE - PERFORMANCE 11.1 Boot Analysis #=== BOOT TIME === systemd-analyze # Overall boot time systemd-analyze time # Same as above # Output: # Startup finished in 3.123s (kernel) + 5.456s (userspace) = 8.579s # graphical.target reached after 5.234s in userspace #=== BLAME (slowest units) === systemd-analyze blame # List by startup time systemd-analyze blame | head -20 # Top 20 slowest #=== CRITICAL CHAIN === systemd-analyze critical-chain # Critical path systemd-analyze critical-chain myapp.service #=== PLOT (graphical) === systemd-analyze plot > boot.svg # SVG timeline # Má»Ÿ boot.svg trong browser #=== DOT (dependency graph) === systemd-analyze dot | dot -Tsvg > deps.svg systemd-analyze dot myapp.service | dot -Tsvg > myapp-deps.svg11.2 Unit Analysis #=== VERIFY UNIT === systemd-analyze verify myapp.service systemd-analyze verify /etc/systemd/system/*.service #=== SECURITY ANALYSIS === systemd-analyze security # All services systemd-analyze security myapp.service # Output: Security score 0-10 (lower is better) # Recommendations Ä‘á»ƒ harden service #=== CALENDAR TESTING === systemd-analyze calendar "Mon..Fri *-*-* 09:00" systemd-analyze calendar --iterations=5 "daily" #=== TIMESPAN PARSING === systemd-analyze timespan "2h 30min" systemd-analyze timespan "1d 12h" #=== CAT-CONFIG === systemd-analyze cat-config systemd/journald.conf # Show effective config with all overrides #=== UNIT PATHS === systemd-analyze unit-paths # All unit file locations #=== CONDITION === systemd-analyze condition 'ConditionPathExists=/etc/myapp.conf'11.3 System Analysis #=== DUMP STATE === systemd-analyze dump # Dump internal state #=== EXIT STATUS === systemd-analyze exit-status 143 # Explain exit code #=== CAPABILITY === systemd-analyze capability CAP_NET_ADMIN #=== SYSCALL FILTER === systemd-analyze syscall-filter @network-io #=== FILESYSTEMS === systemd-analyze filesystems # List filesystem types 12. RESOURCE CONTROL - CGROUPS 12.1 Resource Control Directives [Service] #=== CPU === CPUWeight=100 # Relative weight (1-10000, default 100) CPUQuota=50% # Max CPU time (50% of one core) CPUQuota=200% # Max 200% = 2 cores AllowedCPUs=0-3 # Pin to specific CPUs AllowedMemoryNodes=0 # NUMA nodes #=== MEMORY === MemoryMin=500M # Guaranteed minimum MemoryLow=1G # Soft limit (protected from OOM) MemoryHigh=2G # Throttle limit MemoryMax=4G # Hard limit (OOM killed) MemorySwapMax=1G # Swap limit #=== I/O === IOWeight=100 # Relative weight (1-10000) IODeviceWeight=/dev/sda 200 # Per-device weight IOReadBandwidthMax=/dev/sda 100M # Read limit IOWriteBandwidthMax=/dev/sda 50M # Write limit IOReadIOPSMax=/dev/sda 1000 # IOPS limit IOWriteIOPSMax=/dev/sda 500 #=== TASKS === TasksMax=512 # Max number of tasks (processes/threads) #=== NETWORK (experimental) === IPAddressAllow=192.168.1.0/24 IPAddressDeny=any12.2 Slices â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ SLICE HIERARCHY â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ -.slice (root) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ system.slice â† System services â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ nginx.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ postgresql.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ myapp.slice â† Custom slice cho app â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ myapp-web.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ myapp-worker.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ user.slice â† User sessions â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ user-1000.slice â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ user@1000.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ machine.slice â† VMs vÃ  containers â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ container@mycontainer.service â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜12.3 Custom Slice # /etc/systemd/system/myapp.slice [Unit] Description=MyApp Resource Slice Before=slices.target [Slice] CPUWeight=200 MemoryMax=8G TasksMax=1024# Service sá»­ dá»¥ng slice # /etc/systemd/system/myapp-web.service [Service] Slice=myapp.slice # Resource limits trong slice apply cho táº¥t cáº£ services trong slice12.4 systemd-cgtop # Monitor cgroup resource usage systemd-cgtop # Columns: # Control Group Tasks %CPU Memory Input/s Output/s # / 245 15.2 4.2G 0B 0B # /system.slice 98 10.1 2.1G 0B 0B # /user.slice 147 5.1 2.1G 0B 0B # Options systemd-cgtop -m # Sort by memory systemd-cgtop -c # Sort by CPU systemd-cgtop -t # Sort by tasks systemd-cgtop -n 5 # 5 iterations then exit systemd-cgtop -d 2 # Update every 2 seconds12.5 Runtime Resource Control # Change resource limits at runtime sudo systemctl set-property myapp.service CPUQuota=30% sudo systemctl set-property myapp.service MemoryMax=2G # Persistent (táº¡o drop-in file) sudo systemctl set-property myapp.service --runtime=false CPUQuota=30% # View current limits systemctl show -p CPUQuota myapp.service systemctl show -p MemoryMax myapp.service # View all cgroup info systemctl status myapp.service # Shows: CGroup: /system.slice/myapp.service # â””â”€12345 /usr/bin/myapp # Inspect cgroup directly cat /sys/fs/cgroup/system.slice/myapp.service/memory.current cat /sys/fs/cgroup/system.slice/myapp.service/cpu.stat 13. SECURITY HARDENING 13.1 Security Directives [Service] #=== FILESYSTEM === ProtectSystem=strict # /usr, /boot readonly. /etc readonly náº¿u strict ProtectHome=yes # /home, /root, /run/user inaccessible PrivateTmp=yes # Private /tmp vÃ  /var/tmp PrivateDevices=yes # Private /dev ProtectKernelTunables=yes # /proc/sys, /sys readonly ProtectKernelModules=yes # KhÃ´ng load kernel modules ProtectKernelLogs=yes # KhÃ´ng access kernel logs ProtectControlGroups=yes # /sys/fs/cgroup readonly ProtectProc=invisible # /proc access: default|invisible|noaccess ProcSubset=pid # pid|all # Mount options ReadWritePaths=/var/lib/myapp # Writable paths (khi ProtectSystem=strict) ReadOnlyPaths=/data # Readonly paths InaccessiblePaths=/secret # Inaccessible paths TemporaryFileSystem=/var:ro # Tmpfs overlay BindPaths=/src:/dest # Bind mounts BindReadOnlyPaths=/src:/dest # Readonly bind #=== CAPABILITIES === NoNewPrivileges=yes # KhÃ´ng thá»ƒ gain privileges CapabilityBoundingSet= # Drop all capabilities CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE # Only allow binding <1024 AmbientCapabilities=CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE # Ambient caps for non-root #=== NAMESPACES === PrivateNetwork=yes # Private network namespace (no network) PrivateUsers=yes # Private user namespace PrivateIPC=yes # Private IPC namespace PrivateMounts=yes # Private mount namespace RestrictNamespaces=yes # Cannot create namespaces RestrictNamespaces=~user # Deny specific namespace types #=== SYSCALL FILTERING === SystemCallFilter=@system-service # Allow only system-service calls SystemCallFilter=~@mount # Deny mount calls SystemCallArchitectures=native # Only native arch SystemCallErrorNumber=EPERM # Return this on denied calls #=== MISC === RestrictAddressFamilies=AF_INET AF_INET6 AF_UNIX # Allowed address families RestrictRealtime=yes # No realtime scheduling RestrictSUIDSGID=yes # No SUID/SGID LockPersonality=yes # Lock execution domain MemoryDenyWriteExecute=yes # W^X enforcement UMask=0077 # Restrictive umask #=== SECCOMP === SecureBits=keep-caps # Secure bits13.2 Security Profiles # Minimal network service [Service] DynamicUser=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=yes PrivateTmp=yes PrivateDevices=yes ProtectKernelTunables=yes ProtectKernelModules=yes ProtectControlGroups=yes NoNewPrivileges=yes RestrictRealtime=yes RestrictSUIDSGID=yes SystemCallFilter=@system-service SystemCallArchitectures=native MemoryDenyWriteExecute=yes# High security (paranoid) [Service] User=nobody Group=nobody DynamicUser=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=yes PrivateTmp=yes PrivateDevices=yes PrivateNetwork=yes PrivateUsers=yes PrivateIPC=yes ProtectKernelTunables=yes ProtectKernelModules=yes ProtectKernelLogs=yes ProtectControlGroups=yes ProtectHostname=yes ProtectClock=yes NoNewPrivileges=yes CapabilityBoundingSet= RestrictNamespaces=yes RestrictRealtime=yes RestrictSUIDSGID=yes LockPersonality=yes MemoryDenyWriteExecute=yes SystemCallFilter=@system-service SystemCallFilter=~@privileged @resources SystemCallArchitectures=native RestrictAddressFamilies=AF_UNIX UMask=007713.3 Check Security Score # Analyze security cá»§a service systemd-analyze security myapp.service # Output example: # NAME DESCRIPTION EXPOSURE # âœ— PrivateNetwork= Service has access to host's 0.5 # network # âœ“ PrivateTmp= Service has no access to 0.1 # other software's temp files # ... # â†’ Overall exposure level: 4.5 MEDIUM # Filter by score systemd-analyze security --threshold=5 # JSON output systemd-analyze security myapp.service --json=pretty 14. DEBUGGING & TROUBLESHOOTING 14.1 Debug Commands #=== SERVICE STATUS === systemctl status myapp.service -l # Full output, no truncate systemctl status myapp --no-pager # No pager #=== LOGS === journalctl -u myapp.service -f # Follow logs journalctl -u myapp -n 100 --no-pager journalctl -u myapp -p err # Only errors journalctl -u myapp -b # This boot only #=== SHOW PROPERTIES === systemctl show myapp.service # All properties systemctl show -p ExecStart myapp # Specific property systemctl show -p ActiveState,SubState myapp #=== DEBUG MODE === # TÄƒng verbosity SYSTEMD_LOG_LEVEL=debug systemctl restart myapp # Environment cho debug sudo SYSTEMD_LOG_LEVEL=debug /usr/lib/systemd/systemd --test #=== COREDUMP === coredumpctl list # List coredumps coredumpctl info # Last coredump info coredumpctl gdb # Debug with gdb14.2 Common Issues Issue Solution Service fails to start journalctl -u service -n 50 Check ExecStart path & permissions Unit file not found systemctl daemon-reload Check unit file location & name Service starts but exits immediately Check Type= (use notify if needed) Add RemainAfterExit=yes for oneshot Permission denied Check User=, Group=, WorkingDirectory Check ProtectSystem, ProtectHome Cannot bind to port Check if port in use: ss -tlnp Add CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE for <1024 Environment variables not loaded Check EnvironmentFile path Use - prefix for optional files Service masked systemctl unmask service Dependency issues systemctl list-dependencies Check After=, Requires=, Wants= Timer not triggering systemctl list-timers Check OnCalendar syntax systemd-analyze calendar “expr” Socket activation not working Check ListenStream format Ensure socket enabled, not service OOM killed Check MemoryMax, increase limit journalctl -k | grep -i oom Slow boot systemd-analyze blame systemd-analyze critical-chain 14.3 Debug Checklist #!/bin/bash # Debug script cho systemd service SERVICE="$1" echo "=== Service Status ===" systemctl status "$SERVICE" --no-pager -l echo -e "\n=== Is Enabled? ===" systemctl is-enabled "$SERVICE" echo -e "\n=== Unit File ===" systemctl cat "$SERVICE" echo -e "\n=== Dependencies ===" systemctl list-dependencies "$SERVICE" echo -e "\n=== Properties ===" systemctl show "$SERVICE" | grep -E '^(ExecStart|User|Group|WorkingDirectory|Environment)' echo -e "\n=== Recent Logs ===" journalctl -u "$SERVICE" -n 20 --no-pager echo -e "\n=== Failed Units ===" systemctl --failed echo -e "\n=== Security Score ===" systemd-analyze security "$SERVICE" 2>/dev/null | head -20 15. PRODUCTION TEMPLATES 15.1 Web Application # /etc/systemd/system/webapp.service [Unit] Description=Web Application Documentation=https://example.com/docs After=network-online.target postgresql.service redis.service Wants=network-online.target Requires=postgresql.service Wants=redis.service [Service] Type=notify User=webapp Group=webapp WorkingDirectory=/opt/webapp # Environment Environment=NODE_ENV=production EnvironmentFile=/opt/webapp/.env EnvironmentFile=-/opt/webapp/.env.local # Execution ExecStartPre=/opt/webapp/bin/pre-start.sh ExecStart=/usr/bin/node /opt/webapp/server.js ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID ExecStop=/bin/kill -TERM $MAINPID # Process management KillMode=mixed KillSignal=SIGTERM TimeoutStopSec=30 # Restart policy Restart=on-failure RestartSec=10 StartLimitIntervalSec=300 StartLimitBurst=5 # Resource limits LimitNOFILE=65536 MemoryMax=2G CPUQuota=200% TasksMax=512 # Security NoNewPrivileges=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=yes PrivateTmp=yes PrivateDevices=yes ProtectKernelTunables=yes ProtectKernelModules=yes ProtectControlGroups=yes ReadWritePaths=/opt/webapp/data /opt/webapp/logs RestrictRealtime=yes RestrictSUIDSGID=yes # Logging StandardOutput=journal StandardError=journal SyslogIdentifier=webapp [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target15.2 Background Worker # /etc/systemd/system/worker@.service [Unit] Description=Background Worker %i After=network-online.target rabbitmq.service Wants=network-online.target Requires=rabbitmq.service PartOf=workers.target [Service] Type=simple User=worker Group=worker WorkingDirectory=/opt/app Environment=WORKER_ID=%i EnvironmentFile=/opt/app/.env ExecStart=/opt/app/bin/worker Restart=always RestartSec=5 # Nice priority for background work Nice=10 IOSchedulingClass=best-effort IOSchedulingPriority=7 # Limits MemoryMax=512M TasksMax=64 # Security NoNewPrivileges=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=yes PrivateTmp=yes [Install] WantedBy=workers.target# /etc/systemd/system/workers.target [Unit] Description=All Workers Requires=multi-user.target After=multi-user.target Wants=worker@1.service worker@2.service worker@3.service worker@4.service [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target15.3 Scheduled Task (Timer) # /etc/systemd/system/backup.timer [Unit] Description=Daily Backup Timer Documentation=https://example.com/docs/backup [Timer] OnCalendar=*-*-* 02:00:00 RandomizedDelaySec=30min Persistent=true [Install] WantedBy=timers.target# /etc/systemd/system/backup.service [Unit] Description=Daily Backup Documentation=https://example.com/docs/backup After=network-online.target Wants=network-online.target # Send notification on failure OnFailure=notify-admin@%n.service [Service] Type=oneshot User=backup Group=backup ExecStart=/opt/backup/backup.sh # Timeouts TimeoutStartSec=3600 # Low priority Nice=19 IOSchedulingClass=idle # Security NoNewPrivileges=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=read-only PrivateTmp=yes ReadWritePaths=/backup15.4 Socket-Activated Service # /etc/systemd/system/api.socket [Unit] Description=API Socket Documentation=https://example.com/docs/api [Socket] ListenStream=0.0.0.0:8080 Accept=no NoDelay=true ReusePort=true [Install] WantedBy=sockets.target# /etc/systemd/system/api.service [Unit] Description=API Service Documentation=https://example.com/docs/api After=network.target Requires=api.socket [Service] Type=notify User=api Group=api WorkingDirectory=/opt/api ExecStart=/opt/api/bin/api-server ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID Restart=on-failure RestartSec=5 # Socket activation - khÃ´ng cáº§n bind, nháº­n FD tá»« systemd NonBlocking=true # Security NoNewPrivileges=yes ProtectSystem=strict ProtectHome=yes PrivateTmp=yes # KhÃ´ng cÃ³ [Install] - activated bá»Ÿi socket15.5 Hardened Container Runtime # /etc/systemd/system/container-app.service [Unit] Description=Containerized Application After=docker.service Requires=docker.service [Service] Type=simple ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker stop %n ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker rm %n ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker pull myregistry/myapp:latest ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run \ --name %n \ --rm \ --network=host \ --read-only \ --tmpfs /tmp \ --security-opt=no-new-privileges:true \ --cap-drop=ALL \ --cap-add=NET_BIND_SERVICE \ --memory=2g \ --cpus=2 \ --pids-limit=100 \ --env-file=/opt/app/.env \ -v /opt/app/data:/data:rw \ myregistry/myapp:latest ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop %n Restart=always RestartSec=10 [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target TÃ“M Táº®T NHANH Essential Commands # Lifecycle systemctl start|stop|restart|reload myapp systemctl enable|disable --now myapp systemctl status myapp # Logs journalctl -u myapp -f journalctl -u myapp -p err --since today # Debug systemctl cat myapp systemctl show myapp systemd-analyze security myapp systemd-analyze verify myapp.service # System systemctl daemon-reload systemctl list-units --failed systemd-analyze blameUnit File Essentials [Unit] Description=My Service After=network.target Requires=dependency.service [Service] Type=simple User=myapp ExecStart=/usr/bin/myapp Restart=on-failure EnvironmentFile=/etc/myapp/env # Security basics NoNewPrivileges=yes ProtectSystem=strict PrivateTmp=yes [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.targetTimer Essentials [Timer] OnCalendar=daily # hoáº·c *-*-* 02:00:00 Persistent=true RandomizedDelaySec=10min [Install] WantedBy=timers.target REFERENCES systemd Official Documentation Arch Wiki - systemd Red Hat - Managing Services with systemd DigitalOcean - Systemd Essentials
